definition: (coll.) to tamper with/to mess around with
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks
variant of 角[jue2]/role

sentences.english: Once the character is defined I begin to work on the background and play with color.
sentences.chinese: 人物塑造好後，我就開始在背景和顏色方面動手腳。
你可不能在質量上動手腳。

sentences.english: Importer: Well, you mustn't tamper with quality.
sentences.chinese: 嗯，你可不能在質量上動手腳。

definition: lit. to draw a gourd from the model (idiom)/fig. to copy sth mechanically without attempt at originality
hunger strike
to obstruct/to impede
the trick of injuring oneself to gain the enemy's confidence/CL:條|条[tiao2]
economic difficulty
(jocularly) public building that has been lying idle (and is thus ideal for housing mosquitos) (Tw)
to heave a sigh of relief
war of words

(neologism c. 2013) organized disruption of healthcare facilities or verbal and physical abuse of medical staff, by an aggrieved patient or proxies such as family members or hired thugs, typically aimed at obtaining compensation
delaying tactics/stalling/measures to stave off an attack/stratagem to win a respite
lit. the river that divides Chu and Han/fig. a line that divides rival territories/the mid-line between sides on a Chinese chessboard
to exaggerate
to plan/to arrange
methodology
to advertise/to solicit business
open the net on one side (idiom); let the caged bird fly/to give one's opponent a way out/lenient treatment
